CRUISIN CLASSICS has one just for you. It is a 1954 Ford F-100 Pickup. This is the one that you take two or three looks just to make sure you are seeing the beauty of this one in real life. It's that Nice....Complete "frame off" restoration is the name of this one and the quality of workmanship shines through as you see every detail unfold as your eyes continue to move around this pickup. The Border X Red Metallic paint that was done less than a decade ago still looks like it is as fresh a last week. The interior looks great...all gauges work and the truck is ready to hit the road.

The engine purrs like it should (223, 6 cylinder "Clipper") and has been completely gone through.  It looks as if it just rolled off of the factory floor. The entire engine compartment is spotless as well as all of the components on and around it. Again, the attention to detail is in your face. The 4-speed manual transmission is another piece of the whole puzzle that just belongs on this truck. The long stick shifter for the transmission is inside, on the floor. It has a one-barrel Holley carburetor.

We will summarize that this truck is a MUST HAVE. If anybody is looking for a new classic that is mostly original but yet has been touched by modern hands that really know what they are doing when taking something old and making that old something new again. Now is your chance to hop into the truck side of the classics without disappointment and at the same time, be the envy of all your friends.

For sale is a 1956 Ford F100 Pickup Truck located in our Indianapolis showroom. For the 1953 model year an all-new version of the F-Series made its debut. Increased dimensions improved engines and an updated chassis were features of the second generation. Additionally a change to the F-Series naming scheme would remain in place to the present day. The half-ton F-1 became the F-100 (partially influenced by the North American F-100 Super Sabre) Since then she has undergone a radical restoration. She has received a mildly built 302 that is paired to a strong and trusty AOD from Monster Transmission. This truck has a fantastic rumble to match its style. All the truck appears humble it is packed full of features including A/C a modern retro styled AM/FM radio cruise control heated seats power brakes power steering power locks power windows keyless entry tilt wheel vinyl interior radial tires a soft top tonneau cover to cover the cargo area in the bed. You would be hard pressed to find a better 56 F100 for the value. This truck drives like a dream with the comforts of modern technology and the classic styling of the 50"??s. This 1956 Ford F100 Pickup Truck for sale is located in our Indianapolis Showroom and can be seen in greater detail including a High Def video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. Please call (317)688-1100 or email us at

Depending upon the way you look at this 1954 Ford F-100 it's either a hot rod, cool classic, or a great vintage cruiser. That's because with a performance-built 302 V8, upgraded suspension, and comfy A/C interior, all wrapped in a great vintage pickup body, this offers the best of everything.

Maybe it's the combination of fat fenders and an already low-looking profile. Or perhaps it's that unique front end. Or maybe the real wood truck bed.  Whatever the reason, this F-100 looks fantastic from just about any angle.  The light blue paint is a big help with this appearance.  It's a great shade to represent the pop art of the '50s, especially with supporting elements like the classic Ford family crest leading the way, more Ford crests on the step plates, and vintage chain-latch tailgate.  But this paintwork also has a more modern shine, thanks to over $30k spent on a restoration in 2014. The modern shine helps introduce more aggressive features like the shaved front bumper, rolled rear pan, bright exhaust tips, and 20-inch Ridler wheels.  All of which help hint at the upgrades within.

The interior was restored with an eye for good coordination.  So the white accents of the exterior return on a nicely tailored white bench seat, new matching door panels, and matching piping on the carpet.  They coordinate with the exterior blue that are on the metal elements like the dash and upper doors.  This is meant to be a comfortable cruiser, and so you get upgrades like the removable center console with cup holders, AM/FM stereo, and modern R134a air conditioning all nicely integrated into this interior.  But more than just comfy, you can also instantly tell this was built to be a performance machine.  You slip behind the Grant sports steering wheel on an Ididit tilt steering column.  Just beyond that are a full set of Dolphin gauges that do a great job of looking retro cool thanks to their markings and the chrome instrument panel.  The tall floor shifter even has a nice performance feeling.

When you lift the hood, you'll instantly recognize a motor that was built for both show and go.  After all, the smooth inner fenders and firewall are painted to match the exterior and so is the air topper.  And just about everything else was given a sold investment in a polished presentation.  And there's plenty of substance behind the style. You're looking at a BluePrint 302 cubic-inch performance crate.  It has all the right go-fast goodies like an Edelbrock four-barrel carburetor, performance intake, and shorty headers that feed the rumbling dual exhaust.  But beyond just more power, this pickup has been built with plenty of great modern features like front disc brakes, modern Toyo Proxes tires for grip, three-speed automatic transmission, and a TCI Mustang II style independent front suspension for a superior ride.  You even have an aluminum radiator with an electric fan to keep this performance V8 running cool when you're in traffic with the A/C pumping.  So this is truly an everyday friendly F-100.
Complete with build receipts, you know you're looking at a terrific all-around custom build.  So don't let a vintage truck with this kind of quality slip away.  Call today!!!

Offered for sale is this 1956 Ford F100 Custom Pickup finished in Burgundy over Grey. A restoration was done on the truck in approx. 2003 and remained with its previous owner until recently. This hot-rodded F100 has been fitted with a number of performance modifications and custom touches which set it apart from the crowd.
-Ford 460 V8 with Offenhauser Manifold and Holley Carb

EXTERIOR: The exterior has been resprayed in a single stage Burgundy which presents well overall with a nice shine. The front end has been replaced with a drag-style fiberglass clam shell which retains the factory chrome grill; it is easy to open and secures with racing panel straps. The windshield, windows, and headlights are clear and free of pits and cracks, rubber seals are in good shape, and chrome is in good solid shape overall. A handful of imperfections in the paintwork are noted in the gallery.

In the wood-floored bed, a JAZ racing fuel cell replaces the in-cab OEM fuel tank and is joined by a relocated battery box which adds to the race truck look. Flareside rear fenders have been modified inside the bed to fit extra-wide Weld Drag wheels and Mickey Thompson drag radials (33x19.50 - 15LT).

INTERIOR: Inside the truck, a paint-matched dash houses a custom gauge cluster with Autometer gauges. Grey carpeting is brand new and flows nicely with the grey bench seat and updated headliner. Interior door handles have cracked. A drag-racing style Hurst shifter is equipped with gear lockout. Wiring has been updated/simplified with a Wire Works fuse panel.

DRIVETRAIN/UNDERCARRIAGE: The original engine has been replaced with nice running Ford 460. The mildly modified engine runs nicely and sounds excellent. Equipped with a number of performance modifications including an Offenhauser Intake Manifold, Holley Carb, Accel Ignition Coil and Wires, and Holley Valve Covers for dress-up. The automatic transmission is equipped with a Hurst shifter with shift lock-out. In good running and driving condition with recent carb cleaning and new battery.

Underneath, the rust-fee frame, front suspension arms, the Ford 9" rear end have been painted black and present very well. Features updated Gabriel shocks in the rear, as well as a disc brake conversion for added stopping power. A side-exit exhaust looks the part and sounds great.
For more information or to schedule a test drive, please call or email.
*NOTE: All sales are subject to $300 MVA dealer processing fee and tax, title and registration fees. Vehicles are being sold in as-is condition.
1953 FORD F-100 “50TH ANNIVERSARY” PICK-UP TRUCK  F10D3S13385.

(Stock  3910.) Twenty-five years ago, a local customer found this completely original but well-weathered truck near his farm in Pennsylvania.  He purchased the truck and then commissioned a full body-off-chassis restoration.  Since completion of the comprehensive restoration, the truck has been garaged at the family farm until having just been driven down to The Stable for sale. The body is gorgeous in red, the bed has been beautifully varnished and the interior is still original and in good condition. Power is from the original 215 cubic inch 6-cylinder engine with a 3-speed  (“three-on-the-tree”) manual transmission.  1953 was a unique year for Ford trucks.  That was the year of the “50th Anniversary Edition” pick-ups and is identified as such by a special 50th Anniversary horn button.  This was  also unique year for Ford pick-ups with a slanted cab window and more interior room than the prior Ford pick-ups.  Ours is gorgeous and ready to show, drive anywhere or put to work.  48,322 miles. $32,000.
1954 Ford F-100 Pickup for purchase. A real time capsule, unmolested example maintaining it's original 239 CID V8 “Y Block” engine and 3 speed manual on the column.  Original 69K miles!

This truck remains all steel and features a brand new oak wood bed, engine detailed to original, bone stock original interior, brand new Firestone 6.50-16 tires from Coker. Mechanically, this F-100 is spot on and is a proven driver.  The truck was repainted once in the 60's to the original Meadow Green Color Code “U” identified on the data plate … a real classic color for the period.  The paint still maintains a shine, but does have some patina and a few scratches.  All of the glass is still the original Ford script.  You don't see many original survivors like this one any more !!
Includes an OEM 1954 Ford F-100 AM Radio, not yet installed (a $500 value).  Vinyl door graphics can be easily removed prior to delivery if buyer so desires.

1954 was the second year for the 2nd generation F-Series pick up; a nameplate that still lives on 65 years later. The classic truck market is on fire and the F-100 pick ups of the early 50's remain highly sought after their classic styling and drivability keep it a useable classic.

Crevier Classic Cars is pleased to offer this exceptionally well done 1955 Ford F-100. This truck was restored using correct Ford parts back to stock specification. The super straight body is high-lighted by the rare color of Regatta Blue. The interior is finished in the correct gray vinyl on the bench seat. The pick-up bed features solid oak wood slats that offer both durability and beauty. The drivetrain consists of the in-line six cylinder engine and a three speed manual transmission. As a testament to the quality and authenticity of the restoration, the truck was awarded the AACA National First Place Award in 2010 following the completion of its restoration. Bullet-proof reliability describes how this truck was assembled. This is a drive anywhere and show anywhere '55 Ford F-100. Please contact us at 714-426-0238 or
Classic style meets restoration investments to create this 1955 unique Ford F-100.  It's a V8 street machine with an instant appeal even before you checked out the obtainable price.

Ford already made this second-generation F-series pickups look quite sporty with front fenders that help create an integrated front end and curvy bodywork. It's like they seemed to already know in the '50s what we were going to do to them today.   It just takes pieces like an expertly deleted front bumper, expertly deleted trim, and wider rear fenders to really make this classic come alive with modern flair.  And that's exactly what you see in this pickup.  There was a restoration in 2007, and they added more cool upgrades like bright rear bumper with integrated taillights, sliding rear window, folding tonneau cover, and 15-inch American Racing Torq Thrust wheels.  But this restored Ford also doesn't lose its vintage appeal thanks to classic features like the real wood in the truck bed and the running boards with Ford crest step plate.

Inside is more of the nice blending of the vintage and new worlds.  The bench set is borrowed from a much younger Chevy truck (a hint at the power under the hood.) This cloth seat is far more comfortable and offers better bolstering than you could ever get in the '50s.  The custom headliner now has an overhead console to house the modern AM/FM/CD stereo.  Your right hand rests comfortably on the Lokar shifter, and your left one will love the grip of the sports steering wheel. There's even upgraded petals and auxiliary gauges, including a SunPro tach on the tilt steering column.   But even with all these upgrades, the classic style dash and instrument cluster really give you a great feeling for a '50s Ford.

The engine bay is perfect for showing off.  After all, the red firewall and black inner fenders do a great job of funneling your attention to all of the polished components.  With the air topper, valve covers, alternator, and intake all shining so brightly you know it can easily draw a crowd.  And behind this style is plenty of substance.  This is a 350 cubic-inch crate motor.  And while this fresh V8 is powerful right out of the box, it has nice enhancements like a Quick Fuel four-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock intake, an aluminum radiator w/electric fan, and a rumbling dual exhaust.  Since this is strong package with all the right strong-running accessories, you'll also be glad they made it easy to take on the road.  With power steering, power brakes (w/discs up front), and a TH350 three-speed automatic transmission, this F100 is a fantastic cruiser.
Complete with plenty of build/maintenance receipts and the owner's manual, this is a head-turning custom that's ready to hit the road today.  Call now!!!

TCI 4-link rear on a 9" Ford rear end
3:25 gears in a smoothed rear end housing
Olds 400 Turbo Transmission with a 2000 stall converter

The classic pickup segment is one of the hottest markets right now, and this F100 is as beautiful as they come. Looking resplendent in two tone green paint with paint matched steel wheels with chrome caps. The wood trim on the bed is beautifully done, and adds to the eye catching appeal of this American classic. Inside is done in beautiful green and white two tone with a white vinyl bench seat featuring green piping, and matching green carpets. The sound system has been upgraded and features an AM/FM/CD radio hidden in the glove box. Under the hood is a Ford 312CI Y-block V-8 with many upgrades. The ignition system is all MSD equipment, and a brand new FI tech fuel injection unit sits on top of a performance manifold. Long tube headers and a custom side exit exhaust lend this F100 a super nice sound. The V-8 is mated to a Ford AOD four speed automatic with overdrive, making long drives at high speed an effortless affair. If you're in the market for a super nice classic American pick up truck, you can't do any better than this F100 right here. Stop in or email today and put this American hot rod workhorse in your garage today!!
